quest.name: For Sentimental Reasons
journal: Thiuna appears to be deep in thought.
objectives: Synthesize a workshop sign Deliver the workshop sign to Thiuna.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Whatever should I do...

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Uwaaah! H-How long have you been standing there? I was so deep in thought, I didn't notice you.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: You see, I've been pondering whether to speak with you about Owell. That you should appear at this moment is a sign. Please hear me.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: As you know, Owell and I were orphans taken in by Master Harig.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: We were close friends, playing and arguing with one another in turn, and together we trained as artisans. But all of that changed when Master Harig disappeared.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Young as we were then, we weren't told what became of him. But it's more than likely that, like so many others, he was slain by a sin eater.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: From that time on, Owell and I drifted apart. Eventually we stopped speaking entirely. It was only when I announced my intention to open my shop that he had words for me, and they were none too kind. “You don't understand anything,” he spat out angrily.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Well, he's right in one regard. I don't understand why he so detests my work. It goes beyond mere disapproval. He makes it personal, as if I've done something to offend him.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: This wouldn't be a problem, except Owell holds considerable influence at the Mean. A bad word from him and we would get no more custom. Sooner or later, I'll have to settle our differences, but the mere anticipation of it is nerve-racking. Ah, what I wouldn't give for a stiff drink...

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Command received. <bloop> Instruction to Thiuna: proceed to the Wandering Stairs.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: I...beg your pardon?

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Oh no, Noddy's going to summon Owell!

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: <sigh> Seems it's to be sooner than later... Forename, might I ask you to join me at the Wandering Stairs? I could use the support.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Owell isn't here yet. I wouldn't be surprised if he doesn't come at all.

dialogue.name: OWELL
dialogue.text: Thiuna. So you're the “urgent business” that I had to drop everything for.

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: Affirmative! <buzz> Thiuna has a score to settle with you!

dialogue.name: OWELL
dialogue.text: What was that?

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: N-Nothing. Be quiet now, Noddy.

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <beep> Forced shutdown initiated. <buzzzzzz>

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: There's something I need to ask you, Owell.

dialogue.name: OWELL
dialogue.text: Make it quick. Unlike you, I've got responsibilities.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: All right. Not everyone agrees with what I do. I understand that. What I don't understand is why you're so angry with me.

dialogue.name: OWELL
dialogue.text: You called me here just to ask me that? Hah, urgent business indeed! How easy life must be when your days are filled with play!

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: What we do isn't play! We restore those items that hold sentimental value for the people of the Crystarium!

dialogue.name: OWELL
dialogue.text: Listen well.

dialogue.name: OWELL
dialogue.text: Thanks to the efforts of our ancestors, we've come to enjoy a semblance of a normal life. But shortages are still a daily reality.

dialogue.name: OWELL
dialogue.text: Shortages you do nothing to alleviate! In the time it took you to restore a single decrepit set of amaro barding, I crafted a dozen new ones!

dialogue.name: OWELL
dialogue.text: With Master Harig gone, it falls to me to prop up the Mean.

dialogue.name: OWELL
dialogue.text: It falls to me because Master had to go off to satisfy some vain obsession...and you had to take after him!

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Node restart complete.

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <bloop> Resuming suspended operations. Owell not detected. Shall I fetch him?

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: No, Noddy. Leave him be.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry you had to witness that, Forename. Owell...he didn't use to be that way.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: While I believe in what we do, I can't deny that there's truth to his words. But hmmm... “Go off to satisfy an obsession”...

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: The day Master Harig disappeared, he had ventured out to procure materials. The item he was seeking to restore was... Ah.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Forename, I hate to involve you in my personal dilemmas, but I need your help. Can I rely on you?

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: I'm truly grateful. Let's return to the Crystalline Mean. I'll explain everything there.

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Retrieving profile for Owell. <bloop> A Hume male, Owell is an artisan of the Facet of Crafting. Marital status: single. Favorite beverage: hot milk.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: If Cherished Memories is to survive, we must do something to stem Owell's criticism.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: He's already done damage to our reputation, judging by the recent decline in business.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: We must win him over somehow. Convince him that Cherished Memories is a serious venture, and make him see the true worth of restoration.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: With regards to the latter, I have an idea. There's an item which, if restored, is bound to strum on Owell's heartstrings.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: But I'm at a loss as to how we might show him that we mean business...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you suggest?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Ignore the criticism and let our work speak for us.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Improve the workshop's appearance.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Keep the rustball in check.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Would that we could, but Owell holds too much influence. We have to do something to make him change his mind about us.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Hmmm, now that you mention it, our workshop doesn't have much to draw the eye. Perhaps there's something to be said for looking the part...

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Hmmm? What are you implying about my adorable assistant, pray tell?

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> In order to advertise their presence, shops commonly make use of signage. At present, Cherished Memories has none.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Of course! A sign! Why didn't I think of that?

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Forename, would you be willing to fashion a sign for our workshop?

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: In light of all the help you've given us, it seems only right that you have the honor.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Thank you so much! I can't wait to see the finished product. Oh, and if you run out of materials, Noddy will furnish you with more.

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> I have more materials should you require them.

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Analyzing sign... <buzz> Mmm-hmmm, very nice. I do not know much about signs, but I know what I am programmed to like.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: How fares work on the sign? I can't wait to see it!

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Blessed night, what a magnificent sign this is! It incorporates all the techniques of our restoration work─a perfect representation of who we are! From the design to the details, everything about it is wonderful!

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Not only will this sign attract customers, it will serve to remind me of my goal to emulate your skills. I can't thank you enough for it.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: With this, we can finally show Owell that we mean business.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: I'll see to hanging the sign up as soon as possible. It's bound to be the envy of other artisans!

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: All that remains, then, is to impress upon Owell the true worth of restoration. On which front, there's something I would show you.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: This lute was a gift from the Exarch to Master Harig. Since he left us, it has lain there, broken and silent.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Apparently, it was an enchanted instrument whose power had long faded, but its tone was no less beautiful for it.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Master would often play this lute at the tavern, and Owell and I would go and listen. Seeing how keen we were, he even gave us lessons.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: We loved the rich, soothing sound, and we weren't alone. Whenever Master Harig played, the tavern was always full.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: No matter how rowdy the patrons were, as soon as the first chord was strummed, a hush would fall over the place. The music resonated with them, filling their hearts with peace in both good times and in bad.

dialogue.name: RECORDSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Following Harig's disappearance, however, the lute has been gathering dust.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: W-Well, that's because no one could restore it properly save Master himself. An instrument demands consummate skill. Back then it was completely beyond me, and even now I don't feel equal to the task.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: But I must try. Master wouldn't want to see Owell and I quarreling. No, he'd want us to join hands and serve the Crystarium and her people.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: As it does for me, the lute holds fond memories for Owell. By restoring it, I'm hopeful that we can reach out to him.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Forename, this time it's a personal request. I need your help to make this lute sing once more.

dialogue.name: THIUNA
dialogue.text: Thank you. It gives me heart to have your support. I'll make ready for the restoration and let you know what I require.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next request will be available from Thiuna upon reaching level 78 as a carpenter, leatherworker, or weaver.
